definition: to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to

sentences.english: Don't remember from when, baby George started protesting against our NOs.
sentences.chinese: 不記得從什麼時候開始，寶貝兒就學會了撒潑耍賴。

sentences.english: She was very embarrassed when her child behaved badly in public.
sentences.chinese: 她的孩子在人家面前撒潑，把她窘得下不了臺。

sentences.english: She flounced about like a mad woman.

definition: to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
